page.title: 09Honiton Lace
page.content: The town makes the finest bobbin lace but no longer commercially. The Community College has classes for 100 children and adults taught by Mrs Perryman. Pat Perryman made the jabot worn by the Mayor. Tom Griffiths designed and she made Honiton's gift for the Queen's Silver Jubilee and the jabot worn by the Speaker of the House of Commons. Lace making and an exhibition of old lace can be seen daily at Allhallows Museum. Lace is sold at The Honiton Lace Shop on the High Street. It is made into brooches, pendants and paper weights and sold as souvenirs, thus maintaining the tradition of many centuries.
